trans-unit.source: Backup and Restore for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: Backup and Restore for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: Describes backup and restore considerations for SQL Server databases running on Azure Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: Describes backup and restore considerations for SQL Server databases running on Azure Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: Backup and Restore for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: Backup and Restore for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Backing up data in SQL Server databases is an important part of the strategy in protecting against data loss due to application or user errors.
trans-unit.target: Backing up data in SQL Server databases is an important part of the strategy in protecting against data loss due to application or user errors.

trans-unit.source: This is equally true for SQL Server running on Azure Virtual Machines (VMs).
trans-unit.target: This is equally true for SQL Server running on Azure Virtual Machines (VMs).

trans-unit.source: For SQL Server running in Azure VMs, you can use native backup and restore techniques using attached disks for the destination of the backup files.
trans-unit.target: For SQL Server running in Azure VMs, you can use native backup and restore techniques using attached disks for the destination of the backup files.

trans-unit.source: However, there is a limit to the number of disks you can attach to an Azure virtual machine, based on the <link><linkText>size of the virtual machine</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: However, there is a limit to the number of disks you can attach to an Azure virtual machine, based on the <link><linkText>size of the virtual machine</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: There is also the overhead of disk management to consider.
trans-unit.target: There is also the overhead of disk management to consider.

trans-unit.source: Beginning with SQL Server 2014, you can backup and restore to Microsoft Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Beginning with SQL Server 2014, you can backup and restore to Microsoft Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2016 also provides enhancements for this option.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2016 also provides enhancements for this option.

trans-unit.source: In addition, for database files stored in Microsoft Azure Blob storage, SQL Server 2016 provides an option for nearly instantaneous backups and for rapid restores using Azure snapshots.
trans-unit.target: In addition, for database files stored in Microsoft Azure Blob storage, SQL Server 2016 provides an option for nearly instantaneous backups and for rapid restores using Azure snapshots.

trans-unit.source: This article provides an overview of these options, and additional information can be found at <link><linkText>SQL Server Backup and Restore with Microsoft Azure Blob Storage Service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This article provides an overview of these options, and additional information can be found at <link><linkText>SQL Server Backup and Restore with Microsoft Azure Blob Storage Service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For a discussion of the options for backing up very large databases, see <link><linkText>Multi-Terabyte SQL Server Database Backup Strategies for Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For a discussion of the options for backing up very large databases, see <link><linkText>Multi-Terabyte SQL Server Database Backup Strategies for Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The sections below include information specific to the different versions of SQL Server supported in an Azure virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The sections below include information specific to the different versions of SQL Server supported in an Azure virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Backup Considerations When Database Files are Stored in the Microsoft Azure Blob service
trans-unit.target: Backup Considerations When Database Files are Stored in the Microsoft Azure Blob service

trans-unit.source: The reasons for the performing database backups and the underlying backup technology itself changes when your database files are stored in Microsoft Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: The reasons for the performing database backups and the underlying backup technology itself changes when your database files are stored in Microsoft Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: For more information on storing database files in Azure blob storage, see <link><linkText>SQL Server Data Files in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on storing database files in Azure blob storage, see <link><linkText>SQL Server Data Files in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You no longer need to perform database backups to provide protection against hardware or media failure because Microsoft Azure provides this protection as part of the Microsoft Azure service.
trans-unit.target: You no longer need to perform database backups to provide protection against hardware or media failure because Microsoft Azure provides this protection as part of the Microsoft Azure service.

trans-unit.source: You still need to perform database backups to provide protection against user errors, or for archival purposes, regulatory reasons, or administrative purposes.
trans-unit.target: You still need to perform database backups to provide protection against user errors, or for archival purposes, regulatory reasons, or administrative purposes.

trans-unit.source: You can perform nearly instantaneous backups and rapid restores using the SQL Server File-Snapshot Backup feature in Microsoft SQL Server 2016 Community Technology Preview 2 (CTP2).
trans-unit.target: You can perform nearly instantaneous backups and rapid restores using the SQL Server File-Snapshot Backup feature in Microsoft SQL Server 2016 Community Technology Preview 2 (CTP2).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>File-Snapshot Backups for Database Files in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>File-Snapshot Backups for Database Files in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Backup and Restore in Microsoft SQL Server 2016 Community Technology Preview 2 (CTP2)
trans-unit.target: Backup and Restore in Microsoft SQL Server 2016 Community Technology Preview 2 (CTP2)

trans-unit.source: Microsoft SQL Server 2016 Community Technology Preview 2 (CTP2) supports the <link><linkText>backup and restore with Azure blobs</linkText><title></title></link> features found in SQL Server 2014 and described below.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft SQL Server 2016 Community Technology Preview 2 (CTP2) supports the <link><linkText>backup and restore with Azure blobs</linkText><title></title></link> features found in SQL Server 2014 and described below.

trans-unit.source: But it also includes the following enhancements:
trans-unit.target: But it also includes the following enhancements:

trans-unit.source: Striping: When backing up to Microsoft Azure blob storage, SQL Server 2016 supports backing up to multiple blobs to enable backing up large databases, up to a maximum of 12.8 TB.
trans-unit.target: Striping: When backing up to Microsoft Azure blob storage, SQL Server 2016 supports backing up to multiple blobs to enable backing up large databases, up to a maximum of 12.8 TB.

trans-unit.source: Snapshot Backup: Through the use of Azure snapshots, SQL Server File-Snapshot Backup provides nearly instantaneous backups and rapid restores for database files stored using the Azure Blob storage service.
trans-unit.target: Snapshot Backup: Through the use of Azure snapshots, SQL Server File-Snapshot Backup provides nearly instantaneous backups and rapid restores for database files stored using the Azure Blob storage service.

trans-unit.source: This capability enables you to simplify your backup and restore policies.
trans-unit.target: This capability enables you to simplify your backup and restore policies.

trans-unit.source: File-snapshot backup also supports point in time restore.
trans-unit.target: File-snapshot backup also supports point in time restore.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Snapshot Backups for Database Files in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Snapshot Backups for Database Files in Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Managed Backup Scheduling: SQL Server Managed Backup to Azure now supports custom schedules.
trans-unit.target: Managed Backup Scheduling: SQL Server Managed Backup to Azure now supports custom schedules.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>SQL Server Managed Backup to Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>SQL Server Managed Backup to Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For a tutorial of the capabilities of SQL Server 2016 when using Azure Blob storage, see <link><linkText>Tutorial: Using the Microsoft Azure Blob storage service with SQL Server 2016 databases</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For a tutorial of the capabilities of SQL Server 2016 when using Azure Blob storage, see <link><linkText>Tutorial: Using the Microsoft Azure Blob storage service with SQL Server 2016 databases</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Backup and Restore in SQL Server 2014
trans-unit.target: Backup and Restore in SQL Server 2014

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2014 includes the following enhancement:
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2014 includes the following enhancement:

trans-unit.source: Backup and Restore to Azure:
trans-unit.target: Backup and Restore to Azure:

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Backup to URL now has support in SQL Server Management Studio.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Backup to URL now has support in SQL Server Management Studio.

trans-unit.source: The option to backup to Azure is now available when using Backup or Restore task, or maintenance plan wizard in SQL Server Management Studio.
trans-unit.target: The option to backup to Azure is now available when using Backup or Restore task, or maintenance plan wizard in SQL Server Management Studio.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>SQL Server Backup to URL</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>SQL Server Backup to URL</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Managed Backup to Azure has new functionality that enables automated backup management.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Managed Backup to Azure has new functionality that enables automated backup management.

trans-unit.source: This is especially useful for automating backup management for SQL Server 2014 instances running on an Azure Machine.
trans-unit.target: This is especially useful for automating backup management for SQL Server 2014 instances running on an Azure Machine.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>SQL Server Managed Backup to Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>SQL Server Managed Backup to Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Automated Backup provides additional automation to automatically enable SQL Server Managed Backup to Azure on all existing and new databases for a SQL Server VM in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Automated Backup provides additional automation to automatically enable SQL Server Managed Backup to Azure on all existing and new databases for a SQL Server VM in Azure.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Automated Backup for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Automated Backup for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For an overview of all the options for SQL Server 2014 Backup to Azure, see <link><linkText>SQL Server Backup and Restore with Microsoft Azure Blob Storage Service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For an overview of all the options for SQL Server 2014 Backup to Azure, see <link><linkText>SQL Server Backup and Restore with Microsoft Azure Blob Storage Service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Encryption: SQL Server 2014 supports encrypting data when creating a backup.
trans-unit.target: Encryption: SQL Server 2014 supports encrypting data when creating a backup.

trans-unit.source: It supports several encryption algorithms and the use osf a certificate or asymmetric key.
trans-unit.target: It supports several encryption algorithms and the use osf a certificate or asymmetric key.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Backup Encryption</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Backup Encryption</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Backup and Restore in SQL Server 2012
trans-unit.target: Backup and Restore in SQL Server 2012

trans-unit.source: For detailed information on SQL Server Backup and Restore in SQL Server 2012, see <link><linkText>Backup and Restore of SQL Server Databases (SQL Server 2012)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed information on SQL Server Backup and Restore in SQL Server 2012, see <link><linkText>Backup and Restore of SQL Server Databases (SQL Server 2012)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Starting in SQL Server 2012 SP1 Cumulative Update 2, you can back up to and restore from the Azure Blob Storage service.
trans-unit.target: Starting in SQL Server 2012 SP1 Cumulative Update 2, you can back up to and restore from the Azure Blob Storage service.

trans-unit.source: This enhancement can be used to backup SQL Server databases on a SQL Server running on an Azure Virtual Machine or an on-premises instance.
trans-unit.target: This enhancement can be used to backup SQL Server databases on a SQL Server running on an Azure Virtual Machine or an on-premises instance.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>SQL Server Backup and Restore with Azure Blob Storage Service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>SQL Server Backup and Restore with Azure Blob Storage Service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Some of the benefits of using the Azure Blob storage service include the ability to bypass the 16 disk limit for attached disks, ease of management, the direct availability of the backup file to another instance of SQL Server instance running on an Azure virtual machine, or an on-premises instances for migration or disaster recovery purposes.
trans-unit.target: Some of the benefits of using the Azure Blob storage service include the ability to bypass the 16 disk limit for attached disks, ease of management, the direct availability of the backup file to another instance of SQL Server instance running on an Azure virtual machine, or an on-premises instances for migration or disaster recovery purposes.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of benefits to using an Azure blob storage service for SQL Server backups, see the Benefits section in SQL Server Backup and Restore with Azure Blob Storage Service.
trans-unit.target: For a full list of benefits to using an Azure blob storage service for SQL Server backups, see the Benefits section in SQL Server Backup and Restore with Azure Blob Storage Service.

trans-unit.source: For Best Practice recommendations and troubleshooting information, see <link><linkText>Backup and Restore Best Practices (Azure Blob Storage Service)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For Best Practice recommendations and troubleshooting information, see <link><linkText>Backup and Restore Best Practices (Azure Blob Storage Service)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Backup and Restore in other versions of SQL Server supported in an Azure Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: Backup and Restore in other versions of SQL Server supported in an Azure Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: For SQL Server Backup and Restore in SQL Server 2008 R2, see <link><linkText>Backing up and Restoring Databases in SQL Server (SQL Server 2008 R2)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For SQL Server Backup and Restore in SQL Server 2008 R2, see <link><linkText>Backing up and Restoring Databases in SQL Server (SQL Server 2008 R2)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For SQL Server Backup and Restore in SQL Server 2008, see <link><linkText>Backing up and Restoring Databases in SQL Server (SQL Server 2008)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For SQL Server Backup and Restore in SQL Server 2008, see <link><linkText>Backing up and Restoring Databases in SQL Server (SQL Server 2008)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: If you are still planning your deployment of SQL Server in an Azure VM, you can find provisioning guidance in the following tutorial: <link><linkText>Provisioning a SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you are still planning your deployment of SQL Server in an Azure VM, you can find provisioning guidance in the following tutorial: <link><linkText>Provisioning a SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Although backup and restore can be used to migrate your data, there are potentially easier data migration paths to SQL Server on an Azure VM.
trans-unit.target: Although backup and restore can be used to migrate your data, there are potentially easier data migration paths to SQL Server on an Azure VM.

trans-unit.source: For a full discussion of migration options and recommendations, see <link><linkText>Migrating a Database to SQL Server on an Azure VM</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For a full discussion of migration options and recommendations, see <link><linkText>Migrating a Database to SQL Server on an Azure VM</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Review other <link><linkText>resources for running SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Review other <link><linkText>resources for running SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
